snippet: A rule to be issued by the Labor Department will state that most salaried workers earning up to $47,476 a year must receive overtime pay when they work more than 40 hours.
abstract: Labor Dept is set to issue regulation requiring salaried workers earning up to $47,476 yearly receive time-and-a-half overtime pay when they work over 40 hours in a week; rule, which raises 2004 salary cutoff for overtime pay from $23,660, is part of Obama administration's effort to improve lot of workers; critics, including industries opposing rule and Republicans, say measure will cost billions and undermine morale of salaried employees by requiring them to keep track of hours.
lead_paragraph: A rule to be issued by the Labor Department will state that most salaried workers earning up to $47,476 a year must receive overtime pay when they work more than 40 hours.

headline.main: White House Increases Overtime Eligibility by Millions
headline.print_headline: White House Moves to Make Millions Eligible for Overtime
